title: Arugula And Lemon Couscous From Girlichef
summary: Need a vegan hor d'oeuvre? Arugulan And Lemon Couscous From Girlichef could be an excellent recipe to try. For 29 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 89 calories, 3g of protein, and 2g of fat. This recipe serves 25. If you have juice of lemon, garlic cloves, couscous, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 9 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 40%. This score is not so great. Try Peppermint Slice ‘n Bakes: Holiday Cookie Share with girlichef & McCormick, Couscous-Arugula Salad, and Shrimp with Arugula Couscous for similar recipes.
instructions: Bring broth to a boil in a small pot. Heat oil and garlic in a medium saucepan over medium heat until garlic just begins to turn golden (don't let it get dark or the oil will taste bitter). Carefully lift out the garlic halves and discard. Add couscous to hot oil and fry until it begins to get golden and toasty all over, stirring constantly, ~3-5 minutes. If couscous doesn't seem to be getting colored right away, raise the heat a bit. CAREFULLY pour in the hot broth (stand back, it may spit & spatter) and give everything a stir. Put a tight lid on the pan. Turn off the heat and let sit for 10 minutes. Using a fork, fluff the couscous. Turn it out into a large serving bowl and add the zest and juice of the lemon, the sliced scallions, and the baby arugula. Toss gently. Season to taste with salt and pepper, then toss again. Enjoy as an accompaniment to a meal...or if you're like me, eat it AS the meal.

steps.step: Bring broth to a boil in a small pot.

Heat oil and garlic in a medium saucepan over medium heat until garlic just begins to turn golden (don't let it get dark or the oil will taste bitter). Carefully lift out the garlic halves and discard.

Add couscous to hot oil and fry until it begins to get golden and toasty all over, stirring constantly, ~3-5 minutes. If couscous doesn't seem to be getting colored right away, raise the heat a bit. CAREFULLY pour in the hot broth (stand back, it may spit & spatter) and give everything a stir. Put a tight lid on the pan. Turn off the heat and let sit for 10 minutes. Using a fork, fluff the couscous. Turn it out into a large serving bowl and add the zest and juice of the lemon, the sliced scallions, and the baby arugula. Toss gently. Season to taste with salt and pepper, then toss again. Enjoy as an accompaniment to a meal...or if you're like me, eat it AS the meal.
